com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getSortedShipmentDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getSortedShipmentDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getSortedShipmentDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getSortedShipmentDetails API returns details of a specific shipment with sorting applied on ShipmentLine elements based on Item Id in ascending order.
      If the shipment has order lines which have relationships, the API returns related lines below the parent line.

    • Method Detail

      • getSortedShipmentDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getSortedShipmentDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                       throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                              java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getSortedShipmentDetails API returns details of a specific shipment with sorting applied on ShipmentLine elements based on Item Id in ascending order.
        If the shipment has order lines which have relationships, the API returns related lines below the parent line. The related lines are sorted based on the Item Id.
        If the shipment has order lines with bundles, the API returns bundle components below the bundle parent line. The bundle components are sorted based on the Item Id.
        The getSortedShipmentDetails API accepts ShipmentKey or ShipmentNo, SellerOrganizationCode and ShipNode as input and returns details for all entities related to the shipment in sorted order. Please note that this API is a wrapper API published for COM/SOM screens to use; This sorting is done based on order line attributes, which are added while calling the callee APIs regardless of their presence in the output template, as they are required for sorting logic. If the current API behavior doesn't suit customer requirements, customer can develop a custom API/service that does the same to for their needs.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        The output of getSortedShipmentDetails supplies information about the Shipment. Some key attributes are:

        • AllowedModifications - Provides a list of modification types allowed. Also provides information based on the configuration of the enterprise about whether the modification is allowed through override for a given shipment status.
        • AllowedTransactions - Provides a list of transactions allowed for the given pipeline and status of the shipment.
        • Status - Provides details of all the status properties associated with the given shipment at the current status.
        • ScacAndServiceKey - Published using the information of Scac and CarrierServiceCode available in the entity.
        • ScacAndService- Published using the information of Scac and CarrierServiceCode available in the entity.
        • ChargeNameKey - Made available in the LineCharge and ShipmentCharge nodes, based on ChargeCategory and ChargeName.

        User Exits:

        • com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMGetShipmentInstructionsUE

          The user exits below are invoked only if these 2 conditions are satisified:
          • The PackListPriceInfo element is in the output template
          • The shipment has OrderAvailableOnSystem=Y and has not yet been invoiced (either Pro Forma or Shipment)
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetHeaderChargesForShipmentUE
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetLineChargesForShipmentUE
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateHeaderTaxUE
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSRecalculateLineTaxUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Partial. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the shipment. For details on the output, see the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
